description: Uses the CASA simulator tool to create a simulated measurement set (MS)

parameters.name: msname
parameters.info: Name of MS file to be created

parameters.name: telescope
parameters.info: Name of telescope that being simulated

parameters.name: antenna-file
parameters.info: File that contains antenna coordinates

parameters.name: type
parameters.info: Type of antenna file

parameters.name: coord-sys
parameters.info: Coordinate system of antenna coordinates in 'antenna-file'. Only needed if 'type' is 'ascii'; CASA tables are assumed to be in ITRF coords

parameters.name: lon-lat-elv
parameters.info: Reference position of telescope. Comma seperated longitude,lattitude and elevation 'deg,deg,m'. Elevation is not crucial, lon,lat should be enough. If not specified, we'll try to get this info from the CASA database (assuming that your telescope is known to CASA)

parameters.name: noup
parameters.info: Enable this to indicate that your ENU file does not have an 'up' dimension

parameters.name: direction
parameters.info: Pointing direction. Example J2000,0h0m0s,-30d0m0d. Option --direction may be specified multiple times for multiple pointings. Provide a list of directions for multiple pointings; each pointing will have a unique field ID

parameters.name: synthesis
parameters.info: Synthesis time in hours

parameters.name: scan-length
parameters.info: Durration of a single scan. Default is the entire observation (synthesis)

parameters.name: dtime
parameters.info: Integration time in seconds

parameters.name: freq0
parameters.info: Start frequency. This is the middle of the first channel. Specify as val[unit]. E.g 700MHz, no unit => Hz . Use a comma seperated list for multiple start frequencies (for multiple subbands)

parameters.name: dfreq
parameters.info: Channel width. Specify as val[unit]. E.g 700MHz, no unit => Hz Use a comma separated list of channel widths (for multiple subbands)

parameters.name: nband
parameters.info: Number of subands

parameters.name: nchan
parameters.info: Number of channels. Can be used in tandemn with 'freq0, dfreq, nband' to customise the partitioning of the subands

parameters.name: init-ha
parameters.info: Initial hour angle. 'scan-length/2' is the default

parameters.name: pol
parameters.info: polarization

parameters.name: feed
parameters.info: Feed type

parameters.name: scan-lag
parameters.info: Lag time between scans

parameters.name: set-limits
parameters.info: Set telescope limits. Elevation and shadow limts. Works in tandem with 'shadow-limit, elevation-limit'

parameters.name: elevation-limit
parameters.info: Dish elevation limit. Will only be taken into account if 'set-limits' is enabled.

parameters.name: shadow-limit
parameters.info: Shadow limit. Will only be taken into account if 'set-limits' is enabled.

parameters.name: auto-correlations
parameters.info: Don't flag autocorrelations
